content.user_title: Create a new skill from a clean template
content.value_statement: You need a starting point for a Codex skill. This template provides minimal metadata and a place for instructions.
actual_capabilities: Defines a skill name in YAML front matter
Defines a skill description field in YAML front matter
Provides a markdown section for instructions
Implements a single file skill layout
limitations: No workflows, tools, or scripts are included
The description is a placeholder and must be edited
No usage examples or prompts are provided
No category or tags are specified

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude and Codex?
faq.answer: Yes, it is a plain SKILL.md template that works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It only provides structure and metadata, not workflows or tool integration.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with existing scripts?
faq.answer: Yes, you can add references to scripts after you define instructions.

faq.question: Does it handle user data safely?
faq.answer: It does not process data; it only defines instructions you will add.

faq.question: What if the skill does not trigger?
faq.answer: Check the description and usage rules in SKILL.md for clarity and scope.

faq.question: How does this compare to full skills?
faq.answer: This is a minimal starter file, while full skills include detailed workflows and assets.
